revised_title: Ficus Flora and Biogeography in the New Hebrides
tldr: The author studied the fig flora of the New Hebrides and found a meager but instructive collection of 17 species. The fig-flora indicates a northerly and southerly element in the islands, suggesting that species of Ficus can be distributed overseas up to a certain distance. The author concludes that the New Hebrides' fig-flora did not come via the Solomons and that the sea-gap has been too wide to be crossed.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
